title: Serif with swashed capitals
content:
Hi guys,

I was recently working on a project where i thought the title really needed a serif font with a wide swashed capital J. I could really imagine what i was looking for, yet i’m not sure if this is from memory or just fantasy :)

I found something vaguely similar to what i’m after in the image below, yet what I’m particularly thinking of is slightly more modern and bigger, wider swashes.

Any suggestions would be highly appreciated!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071209082625im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cherylbailey_5087.jpg)

 [‹ Does anybody know what this is? Help me plz](http://web.archive.org/web/20071209082625/http:/typophile.com/node/39841 "Go to previous forum topic") [koenig books - custom ? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071209082625/http:/typophile.com/node/39858 "Go to next forum topic")
author: xen

comments.content:
Poetica.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/poetica/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071209082625/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/poetica/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/poetica/")

Chancery I and Supp Swash Caps IV.

Or, if you’re using modern apps, just use the OpenType version - what used to be a zillion fonts baked into one.

T
